10 Markdown Files That Define How Your AI Agent Behaves

Animae Agentis generates a complete behavioral framework for autonomous AI agents — identity, values, safety boundaries and operational rhythm — from a single source of truth. Built on OpenCLAW 0.1.

What You Get

Configure your AI agent's personality, safety boundaries, operational rhythm, and export 12 production-ready Markdown configuration files:

  • SOUL.md — Immutable rules & truth policy
  • IDENTITY.md — Name, title & tone of voice
  • USER.md — Autonomy rules & output format
  • HEARTBEAT.md — Health checks & discovery loops
  • SHIELD.md — Blocks destructive actions
  • SPIRIT.md — Single source of truth
  • CORTEX.md — File map & naming conventions
  • MEMORY.md — Stable facts & learned patterns
  • VERSION.md — Migration & compatibility
  • OPS.md — Model routing & cost control
  • AGENTS.md — Multi-agent collaboration rules
  • TOOLS.md — Available tool definitions

How It Works

  1. Choose a Preset — Pick from Security-First, Responsible AI, or OverClaw, or start from scratch.
  2. Guided Interview — Walk through 6 phases: handshake, discovery, vibecoding, constitution, pulse, and generation.
  3. Fine-Tune — Adjust every field in the builder for advanced customization.
  4. Validate — Traffic-light scoring detects issues. Auto-repair fixes them.
  5. Download — Export all files as a ZIP or individually. No backend, runs entirely in your browser.

Usus — Educational Deep-Dives

Practical use cases, tutorials, and guides for configuring autonomous AI agents. Learn how to set up safety boundaries, define agent personality, and structure multi-agent collaboration.

Animae Verba — Weekly Reflections

Articles on agentic design philosophy, autonomous systems, and the principles behind self-defining AI agents.
